section.name: Reference installations
section.p: This section lists a limited selection of sites where EJBCA have been deployed succesfully. As any software installations things move around over time, so the number of users etc should be considered an indication, not an absolute number.
If you like to be present on the list of reference installations, please contact us.

ul.li: Solution 1: Internal CA. Operational since 2002. Using EJBCA to authenticate users for access to internal web services and email both from internal network and from internet. Issues both smart cards (using PrimeCard) and soft tokens to users.

Solution 2: External CA. Operational since 2004. Using EJBCA for partners and demo purposes. Each partner have their own SubCA and all CAs sses smart card HSM for protection of CA private keys. Issues both smart cards (using PrimeCard or manual enrollment using different CSPs) and soft tokens to users.
Installed by: Linagora S.A with support from PrimeKey Solutions AB

Solution: Operational since april 2005. Backup PKI infrastructure. Uses nCipher HSM for CA key storage at root CA, and have several sub CAs. Issues soft tokens (pkcs12) to users using browsers and email clients.
Count of Users: Up to 1000 in the first phase
Trade of Industry: Trade and Commerce

Solution: Pilot installation. Operational since dec 2004. Using EJBCA for issuing digital certificates. In combination with smart cards. Advanced setup with smart cards used for login to Active Directory infrastructure, browsers and email clients. Special use is key backup and recovery.
Solution: Pilot installation. Operational since 2005. Using EJBCA for issuing certificates for VPN purposes.
Count of Users: Up to 25000 users.
Location: ZhuHai city, GuangDong province, China
Solution: Operational since 2003. Use EJBCA as user database for Websphere. Login to application with forms and XML-signatures created using smart cards with certificates from EJBCA.
Count of Users: Up to 25000 in the first phase
Trade of Industry: Health Care (Pharmaceutical area)/Public Sector
Solution: Are using EJBCA to generate digital certificates internally and to their customers through a B2B-portal.
Solution: Operational since 2004. Are using EJBCA to generate digital certificates to the financial sector.
Trade of Industry: Bank and Finance
Solution: Operational since 2004. Using EJBCA for issuing digital certificates (soft tokens).

Solution: Operational since feb 2003. Uses smart cards issued to employees. Advanced setup with smart cards used for login to Active Directory infrastructure, browsers and email clients. Special use is key backup and recovery.
